title: Buying Or Selling A Home? Check Out This Podcast
text: By Jane Bianchi This story originally appeared on LearnVest . In case you haven’t noticed, America is podcast obsessed. Just look at the millions of fanatical “Serial” fans out there who couldn’t wait to tune in last fall to follow the real-life mystery of a Baltimore girl who disappeared in 1999—and the man who was convicted of killing her. Not a true crime junkie yourself?That’s O.K. There are plenty of podcasts for the picking—and listening.In fact, we’ve scavenged a great one just in time for fall house-hunting season: “Real Estate Today,” hosted by Gil Gross in conjunction with the National Association of Realtors.True, it’s not as dramatic and chilling as “Serial,” but it is devoted to revealing secrets and solving mysteries—even if they are just of the real estate kind.So if you’re in the market for tips on buying your dream home—and keeping it in good shape once you have it—this podcast is worth a spin.RELATED: Checklist: I'm Ready for a Home! 9 Tips for Stress-Free Home-Buying The Gist: This weekly series has been going strong since 2009, covering everything from improving curb appeal to advice on how to make an offer on new digs.Gross, an award-winning radio journalist, shares recent real estate news, discusses market trends, interviews experts and answers burning home-buying questions. How to Listen: You can tune in on the Real Estate Today site , iTunes and local radio stations ( check here for listings ). Each episode is 75 minutes long. Recent Hot Topics: Tips on making a fast transaction t Selling your place t Dealing with neighbors t How to protect your home from a storm t Buying overseas t How to think like a home inspector Good Episodes for Newbie Listeners: Kicking off a search for your first home? Check out “ First Time Buyers ” (August 8, 2015), which covers such key topics as how to get the best mortgage, how to suss out the right real estate agent and whether to opt for a condo or a single-family home.If you’re already a homeowner, you may like “ Ten Ways to Increase the Value of Your Home ” (July 11, 2015). This episode is chock-full of home improvement advice, including why you should prioritize kitchen updates, which rooms you should repaint and many other tips for maximizing your home’s worth.RELATED: Ready to Buy a Home? 7 Key Questions to Ask Yourself First
